verses.verse: A Prayer of David. Hear <WH8085> the right <WH6664>, O Jehovah <WH3068>, attend <WH7181> unto my cry <WH7440>; Give ear <WH238> unto my prayer <WH8605>, that goeth not <WH3808> out of feigned <WH4820> lips <WH8193>.
Let my sentence <WH4941> come forth <WH3318> from thy presence <WH6440>; Let thine eyes <WH5869> look <WH2372> upon equity <WH4339>.

Thou hast proved <WH974> my heart <WH3820>; Thou hast visited <WH6485> me in the night <WH3915>; Thou hast tried <WH6884> me <WH4672>, and findest nothing <WH2161>; I am purposed that my mouth <WH6310> shall not transgress <WH5674>.
As for the works <WH6468> of men <WH120>, by the word <WH1697> of thy lips <WH8193> I have kept <WH8104> me from the ways <WH734> of the violent <WH6530>.
My steps <WH838> have held fast <WH8551> to thy paths <WH4570>, My feet <WH6471> have not slipped <WH4131>.
I have called <WH7121> upon thee <WH6030>, for thou wilt answer me <WH410>, O God: Incline <WH5186> thine ear <WH241> unto me <WH8085>, and hear my speech <WH565>.
Show thy marvellous <WH6395> lovingkindness <WH2617>, O thou that savest <WH3467> by thy right hand <WH3225> them that take refuge <WH2620> in thee From those that rise up against them <WH6965>.
Keep <WH8104> me as the apple <WH380> of the eye <WH1323>; Hide <WH5641> me under the shadow <WH6738> of thy wings <WH3671>,
From <WH6440> the wicked <WH7563> that <WH2098> oppress <WH7703> me <WH5315>, My deadly enemies <WH341>, that compass me about <WH5362>.
They are inclosed <WH5462> in their own fat <WH2459>: With their mouth <WH6310> they speak <WH1696> proudly <WH1348>.
They have now compassed <WH5437> us in our steps <WH838>; They set <WH7896> their eyes <WH5869> to cast us down <WH5186> to the earth <WH776>.
He is like <WH1825> a lion <WH738> that is greedy <WH3700> of his prey <WH2963>, And as it were a young lion <WH3715> lurking <WH3427> in secret places <WH4565>.
Arise <WH6965>, O Jehovah <WH3068>, Confront <WH6923> him <WH6440>, cast him down <WH3766>: Deliver <WH6403> my soul <WH5315> from the wicked <WH7563> by thy sword <WH2719>;

From men <WH4962> by thy hand <WH3027>, O Jehovah <WH3068>, From men <WH4962> of the world <WH2465>, whose portion <WH2506> is in this life <WH2416>, And whose belly <WH990> thou fillest <WH4390> with thy treasure <WH6840>: They are satisfied <WH7646> with children <WH1121>, And leave <WH3240> the rest <WH3499> of their substance to their babes <WH5768>.
As for me <WH2372>, I shall behold thy face <WH6440> in righteousness <WH6664>; I shall be satisfied <WH7646>, when I awake <WH6974>, with beholding thy form <WH8544>.
